results.title: What makes weather?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and David Jay
results.brief_description: Explains the concepts and terminology of weather forecasting. Uses time-lapse cinematography to show cloud formations and topical influences, and live-action experiments and animation to illustrate unequal heating and the resulting effects of cold and warm air masses.
results.description: Explains the concepts and terminology of weather forecasting. Uses time-lapse cinematography to show cloud formations and topical influences, and live-action experiments and animation to illustrate unequal heating and the resulting effects of cold and warm air masses.

results.title: What makes the wind blow?
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
This film studies the causes of a typical onshore sea breeze and a violent wind storm. It shows laboratory experiments designed to discover the possible causes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: What makes rain
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William Kay
results.brief_description: Designed for primary classes this film answers the child’s question, “What makes rain?”, dealing simply with the water cycle and the nature and causes of rainfall. Examines cloud formation, traces the origin of raindrops, hail, sleet and snow. Also shows what happens in areas where rain does not fall.
results.description: Designed for primary classes this film answers the child’s question, “What makes rain?”, dealing simply with the water cycle and the nature and causes of rainfall. Examines cloud formation, traces the origin of raindrops, hail, sleet and snow. Also shows what happens in areas where rain does not fall.

Examines cloud formation, traces the origin of raindrops, hail, sleet and snow. Also shows what happens in areas where rain does not fall.

results.title: What makes me, me
results.creator_credit: Robbie Palm, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: One of Robbie Palm’s favourite things is fishing at the creek of his nan’s property. Even though he goes to boarding school in Brisbane, he returns during school holidays to fish. He has been taught by his family the techniques and it is this, and when he plays the Didgeridoo that Robbie feels most connected to his culture. When he plays, he feels proud and watched by his family, both current and past.

results.title: What makes day and night
results.brief_description: This is one of a series of films designed for elementary school science classes; it demonstrates that the alternation of night and day is due to rotation of the earth and not to the apparent motion of the sun around the earth. Two children and their father discuss the cause of night and day using a torch and a light globe to demonstrates the principles involved.
results.description: This is one of a series of films designed for elementary school science classes; it demonstrates that the alternation of night and day is due to rotation of the earth and not to the apparent motion of the sun around the earth. results.title: What makes clouds
results.creator_credit: Warren Brown, Stanley Croner, Frederic Goodich and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Fogs and cloud are composed of droplets of water. This film conducts an experiment with condensation producing fog in a bottle and concludes with an investigation of how condensation occurs in nature.

results.title: What little girls are made of (TEFC)
results.brief_description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.
